content.description: Nice problem traversing along the main right face of the boulder beggining with flatter holds leading into deep positive hug rails.
content.location: Starts on the right ledge of The Great Libyan Desert boulder, topping out toward the end of the rail line at the top.

content.description: Starts in a ledge going straight up the right arete of the boulder through a mix of crimps and slopers through the topout.
content.location: Located on the right arete of The Great Libyan Desert on the same start as Sandstorm.  Make your way up some good crimps and sloper to and through the topout.

content.description: A big one move dyno to a nice rail followed by a somewhat tough mantle topout.
content.location: Starts on two crips toward the bottom of a crack line on the left side for The Great Libyan Desert. Dyno up to a rail and topout with the same finish as the Great Pyramids of Giza. (PS. the rock slightly separated from the boulder at the bottom is off for feet unless you want the problem to be boring).

content.description: Another nice traverse problem working trough nice jugs finishing with a larger move to a good rail and a tougher mantle topout.
content.location: Located in the middle of The Great Libyan Desert traversing to the left end.  Starts to the left of the split in the middle of the boulder.

content.description: Start as for Anubis's Crevasse, once you have moved off the start holds and into the horizontal crack trend left and traverse over to and finish on the same topout as The Great Pyramids of Giza stand.
content.location: Middle of the Fox Den wall. Shares a start with Anubis's Crevasse and then trends left across the wall.

content.description: Start right hand in the crack and left of the sidepull.  Work your way up the side pulls to the right of the split rock into some crimps. Make a larger move to a jug rail and top out. Problem goes at V4 without the bottom rock for feet and V3 with the bottom rock for feet.
content.location: Located in the middle of the Fox Den problems at the crack that goes up into the split of the rock.

content.description: Sit start, as for Anubis & Giza, with right hand in crack and left hand on side pull (or undercling), pull on and move up to the horizontal crack. Trend left through a couple of good crimps to the huge jug at ~chest height. From here go straight up through a couple of good edges and a crack to an easy topout.
content.location: In the middle of the Fox Den face on a shared start with Anubis's Crevasse and The Great Pyramids of Giza (Low). Left of the large tree in the middle of the taller overhanging face.

content.description: A small overhanging band off the spur road, centrally located between Yosemite, Druid Circle and the Egg. This little ledge within the woods had its first recorded route 'Foxy' established back in the late 70’s by John  MacLean (aka Whitey). Holds a good variety of mid range problems on nice stone. Most of the original FA's and names (if they ever had any) have been lost to time.
